conclusion: To find the charge of the small ball, analyze the forces acting on the ball and apply physics principles.
When voltage U is applied, an electric field E is created between the plates.
The electric field can be calculated as E = U/d.
The force due to the electric field on the charged ball is F_e = qE = q(U/d).
The gravitational force acting on the ball is F_g = G.
The ball's path changes direction to BC, forming a 45-degree angle with the vertical.
The horizontal component of the force F_e must be equal to the vertical gravitational force F_g.
Write the equation F_g = F_e cos 45°.
Rearrange the equation to solve for q: q(U/d) = G√2.
The charge amount q of the small ball is q = (Gd√2)/U.
